subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A good deed by:  Ahhh the infamous Fish!
author: Lisby
full_text:
I remember when this was going on, I heard a lot of these EVP on the  
Jeff Rense Show. Sandra had been on the AA-EVP board before that, but  
had left. I wish she would put up all the EVPs because some of them  
were really, really impressive. The ones she's got on this site are  
not good examples of what she was getting, HMO.

As for the Fish Group mention--I'm surprised about that, but they  
were plaguing people on the list at that time. Since I tend to see  
them more as 4Chaners (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/4chan) than  
demons, it would make a lot of sense that they would get involved  
with bringing Scott Peterson down.

Ann


On Aug 18, 2008, at 12:46 PM, Ron Lederer wrote:

>
> w. I just finished a couple hour review of the web site you sent  
> for Sandra Belanger at http://www.heliumraven.com/home    Man did  
> that answer a lot of questions I had about how this technology can  
> work with mediumship/spiritualism.  Also renewed my hope in working  
> with evpmaker.  The case history that Sandra recounts on the site  
> should be a "must read" for anyone serious about evp.itc.  I would  
> like to understand more about the relationship between evp and  
> mediumship.  Does a "good" evper need to be a "sensitive" or medium  
> or does it just give someone with the sensitivity the edge over  
> someone else?  Even Sandra now says that she had a certain amount  
> of "sensitivity" before she started using evp technology and that  
> now she actually "communicates directly" with spirit.  To me that  
> means she is a medium....no?
>
> Also, regarding the Fish Group...I was taken back to read on her  
> website that The Fish Group was helpful in having her "solve" the  
> Lacy Peterson case.   Chalk a good deed up to The Fish Group.    
> Thanks for the web site.  Ron l
>
> --- On Mon, 8/18/08, black bear hollow <blackbearhollow@...>  
> wrote:
> From: black bear hollow <blackbearhollow@...>
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Monday, August 18, 2008, 9:23 AM
>
> I'd love to hear about it Zack. Love that stuff.
>
> w.
> On Aug 18, 2008, at 11:23 AM, Zack Widup wrote:
>
>> I could go into that quite a bit, having studied quantum  
>> electrodynamics
>> extensively. But everything - matter, light, all forms of energy,  
>> etc.
>> all break down to ... motion. It just builds into more complicated  
>> schemes
>> and becomes light, sound, radio waves, coffee cups and coffee, etc.
>> :-)
>>
>> Zack
>
>
>
>
